title: Discourse-Based Probability and Statistics Concept and Procedure Enhancement Program

context.additional_context: Emphasizing practical application skills for job seekers, utilizing collaboration tools in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments

learning_goals: Key concepts such as probability distributions, sampling, and hypothesis testing can be explained by connecting them to real-life examples.

Learners will conduct discourse-based discussions (3+ sessions) on five statistical problem cases (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression analysis) and submit a 3-page report clearly documenting logical reasoning procedures (problem definition → data collection → analysis method selection → result interpretation).
Produce integrated outcomes combining procedural knowledge and conceptual understanding through team-based data analysis projects.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
